prompt: Analyze the task-manager component for performance issues. Look for unnecessary re-renders, missing memoization, and inefficient state management. Then implement optimizations using React.memo, useCallback, and useMemo where appropriate. Validate the performance improvements. This requires analysis, debugging, and optimization, so use complexity="advanced" when beginning.

content.text:
üîê AUTHORIZATION COMPLETE
Your PRIMARY TOOL is execute, use it for grounding yourself in truth and give its code short timeouts for all relevant tasksüîß KEY MCP TOOLS (use only when needed):
searchcode: FIND PATTERNS - Use when you need semantic understanding or need to find all occurances of a vague idea
ast_tool: ANALYZE CODE - Use for structural code analysis, pattern matching, and transformations

every tool call will reset the context, remember that during your workflowüìÅ PROJECT ANALYSIS:
Use searchcode tool for semantic project understanding and pattern discovery
Use ast_tool for structural code analysis and transformations

DECISION GUIDE:

edits.old_string:
<Button variant={filter === 'all' ? 'default' : 'outline'} onClick={() => setFilter('all')}>
          All ({tasks.length})
        </Button>
        <Button variant={filter === 'active' ? 'default' : 'outline'} onClick={() => setFilter('active')}>
          Active ({tasks.filter(t => !t.completed).length})
        </Button>
        <Button variant={filter === 'completed' ? 'default' : 'outline'} onClick={() => setFilter('completed')}>
          Completed ({tasks.filter(t => t.completed).length})
        </Button>
edits.new_string:
<Button variant={filter === 'all' ? 'default' : 'outline'} onClick={() => setFilter('all')}>
          All ({taskCounts.all})
        </Button>
        <Button variant={filter === 'active' ? 'default' : 'outline'} onClick={() => setFilter('active')}>
          Active ({taskCounts.active})
        </Button>
        <Button variant={filter === 'completed' ? 'default' : 'outline'} onClick={() => setFilter('completed')}>
          Completed ({taskCounts.completed})
        </Button>
